THE UNIVERSITY
OF NORTH DAKOTA
RADIO STATION K F J M
August 12, 1942
University Station
Grand Forks, North Dakota
Mr* Frank E. Schooled, Executive Secretary
The National Association of Educational
Broadcasting
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Sir:
In regard to your letter to Harold Engel concerning the
convention, it is very doubtful if a representative from
this University would he able to attend the convention
this year- I personally would like to go hut since the
engineering summer session will not end until September 19
and the fall semester begins again the 28th, and my extraÂ¬
curricular work, teaching Naval cadets radio, would make
it impossible for me to get away for a long enough time to
make the trip.
If other members are considering postponing the national
convention, I believe that it would be advisable to do so
from our standpoint.
As you have probably noted from the news releases, KFJM
has been silent during the summer. We expect to start
our two-hour a day broadcast again when school starts this
fall.
You might be interested to know that we have been doing
some research work here at the University on frequency modulation.
We are applying for a patent for a wide band single tube f.m.
broadcasting system. I hope in a short time to be able to
f-elease more definite information on this patent.
Yours very truly,
Assistant Professor of Electrical
Engineering
